admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
trustfund:
TF071086-Trust Fund for Co-financing of
            the Vietnam Rural Distribution Project,TF094257-Vietnam - Cofinancing for Rural
            Distribution Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rural Distribution Project for
            Vietnam had an overall satisfactory outcome with the
            performances of the Bank and the borrower being deemed
            satisfactory as well. All six project development objective
            indicators were fully achieved, as were the two intermediate
            outcome indicators. The project objectives and design were
            felt to be highly relevant to the development priorities of
            the country. Significant lessons learned during project
            implementation include: 1) selection of works contractors is
            critical to successful delivery; 2) the manufacture and
            delivery of equipment should be properly sequenced with
            civil works; 3) project management is a core skill for any
            power distribution company, and requires a range of skills;
            4) the coordination between the authorities involved in the
            project implementation needs to be strengthened further; 5)
            significant delays in the procurement of goods have a very
            negative impact on construction and the delivery of improved
            services; 6) early, comprehensive, effective and on-going
            engagement by power companies with all levels of local
            government and with affected persons is essential to
            resolving land acquisition and clearances; 7) economic
            slowdowns can result in dramatic reductions in forecast load
            growth; 8) community supervision of environmental safeguards
            is a highly effective means of ensuring community ownership,
            minimizing disputes, and having rapid and ongoing compliance
            with environmental management plans; and 9) flexibility is
            essential when a project has a large numbers of
            sub-components that have to be implemented in difficult
            areas over a long period of time.
